column4: I'm trying to use the .deb package installer...I'm getting an error that says "Dependency is not satisfiable:  liblqr1"  Does it mean I'm screwed, or can I fix this somehow?
if you are new to ubuntu, I suggest you use synaptic, or just "sudo apt-get install" to install packages
you don't have to handle .deb directly
I've tried that, but it installs an older version of this particular plugin than what I can use
if you definitely need newer versions, you may try to upgrade to ubuntu-8.10 (beta), or backport the package
check whether the new version is in 8.10, http://packages.ubuntu.com
yes, it should be smooth for experienced users, if you don't want to risk, backports is better
check whether the version you want is in 8.10 first
will do
8.10 has gimp-2.6.1-1ubuntu2
I'm using gimp 2.6.1 now...I need the updated version of this particular script
then, you should upgrade to 8.10, /j #ubuntu+1
backporting gimp could be nasty
Ok, but I'm not even sure this plugin is in the new version
if you need the current development version of gimp, the best chance is still going to 8.10 and backporting experimental, or just gimp-development
I have the latest GIMP installed...just need the latest version of this plugin to work on it
2.6.1 is the latest
That's what I have
as I said, 8.10 has 2.6.1
...but I don't know if it has the latest version of this plugin, which is separate from GIMP
If I upgrade to 8.10, is it possible that .deb package I was trying earlier would work properly?
not sure, unless it's built for the specific ubuntu version
otherwise, you'd better get source of the .deb and build your own
